titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Great Britain, Parliament, 1628, Journal of the Proceedings
Great Britain Parliament, 1628, Journal of the Proceedings
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday February 16, 2019 at 04:00
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: [Journal of the proceedings in Parliament]

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Anonymous 17th century MS. Includes speeches, petitions, messages, and committee proceedings. Most printed in Rushworth, v.i., but the versions in this MS are much longer and more complete. Includes the Commons' remonstrance to the King, April 1626. Signature of Thomas Cole on inside cover and his stamp. From the library of Dr Cox Macro and later of Hudson Gurney. The historical MSS Commission reported on this MS in the XII Report, Part IX, p.123, #XIV.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn fb165 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Great Britain, Parliament, 1628, Journal of the Proceedings. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn fb165. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
"A Commission to the Lordes and others of the privie Counsell concerning the present raising of Money"

[1627/8 Feb 29]
3 p.
MS copy. Rushworth, v.i, 614.
p.1-3.

[Petition to the King, 1627]

scopecontent.p:

MS copy. Presents arguments against

which he has refused to pay.
Rushworth, v.i, 429.

p.27-33.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1628.
[The conference between the two Houses concerning the liberties of the subject, 1628 Apr 3]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
155 p.
Contemporary MS copies. Includes
speeches by Sir Dudley Digges, Edward
Littleton, baron of Littleton, John
Seldon, and Sir Edward Coke, and
the arguments against them by the
attorney general. Also included are
copies of the legal precedents used
as evidence on both sides.
LJ, III, 717 and Rushworth, v.i, 527.
p.123-282.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649

Rushworth, v.i, 538.
p.283-284.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1628.
[Proceedings against Dr Roger Manwaring, 1628 Apr-Jun]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p.
Contemporary MS copies. Francis Rous'
(1579-1659) charge against Manwaring
(1590-1653); a brief of Manwaring's
tenets; the censure of Manwaring in
the Lords and Manwaring's submission.
Rushworth, v.i, 577, 605.
p.304-310.
